On March 12th, households will begin receiving official Census Bureau mail with detailed information on how to respond to the 2020 Census online, by phone, or by mail.

It’s important that everyone in our community is counted. Census responses drive decisions on how $675 billion in federal funds is given to states, communities, and schools. Those dollars help fund our programs such as Special Education, Free and Reduced-Price Meals, Classroom Technology, Training, and more. It doesn’t matter if your student doesn’t use these programs, getting a proper count is important for us to be able to serve those who do need it.

Go to www.2020census.gov for more information, including how the Census Bureau protects your data.
